page.title: 02THE SCHOOL,KING'S NYMPTON
page.content: The{King's Nympton County Primary {School,}built in 1929, provides full time education for children between the ages of five and eleven. It has two full-time teachers,the children being grouped in two classes, Infants and Juniors. In July 1985 there are forty pupils on roll. The school site is an attractive one on the south side of the village and has a playing field, an Environmental Studies Area The children are encouraged to take an interest in the environment. A small Learner Pool allows children to have swimming practice on the premises. The curriculum includes{Mathematics, {Language, Humanities, Physical {Education}and{Creative Expression.}To redress the problem of small peer groups the school participates in work with other small schools under a County Scheme called{COSS.
